title: What are some good analogies for something that mean something is simple or easy to do? - Quora

response.answer_text: How easy is it for the average person to eat a yummy pie? Pretty easy, right? When something is simple or easy to do, you can say, “That’s as easy as eating pie.” Or, you could shorten this to “Easy as pie!” Yes, this is the etymology of the phrase easy as pie, and it’s a good analogy for something that is simple or easy to do.

Easy as…[eating a] “piece of cake” Easy as…[taking a] “cakewalk” (whatever that is) Easy as…“taking candy from a baby” (if you are evil) Easy as…“[counting] 1–2–3” (if you are easily impressed) Easy as…”a breeze” or “a snap” (some are metaphors not analogies)
